meanings.definition: To sing or recite in a joyful and melodious manner.
meanings.sent1: The children carolled happily during the school play.
meanings.sent2: She carolled a beautiful tune at the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside carolled a cheerful morning greeting.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carolled through the halls, filling them with joy.
meanings.sent5: The choir carolled with such passion that the audience was moved to tears.

meanings.definition: To sing Christmas songs or hymns in a lively and festive manner.
meanings.sent1: Every year, the family carolled together around the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The carolers carolled through the neighborhood spreading holiday cheer.
meanings.sent3: Santa carolled his way through the night, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent4: The festive group carolled under the twinkling lights of the tree.
meanings.sent5: The children carolled with glee as they went door to door singing.
